title: Casting to `dyn Trait` implies `'static` lifetime, but "lifetime may not live long enough" does not prompt

labels.name: A-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: Messages for errors, warnings, and lints

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: D-terse
labels.description: A diagnostic that doesn't give enough information about the problem at hand

body:
This is taken from https://users.rust-lang.org/t/why-cant-i-use-reference-of-a-reference-in-the-current-scope-cast-requires-that-1-must-outlive-static/83983, but I think it's worth an issue to improve the diagnostic hints. Given the following code: [Playground link](https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=stable&mode=debug&edition=2021&gist=08abbe0e089f86d6ce42dbaf93c30b4f) ```rust fn do_something(parent: &Hierarchical

) { let h: &dyn View = parent; } ``` The current output is: ``` error: lifetime may not live long enough --> src/main.rs:62:24 | 61 | fn do_something(parent: &Hierarchical

) { | ------ has type `&Hierarchical<'1, P>` 62 | let h: &dyn View = parent; | ^^^^^^ cast requires that `'1` must outlive `'static` ``` Ideally the output should look like: ``` error: lifetime may not live long enough --> src/main.rs:62:24 | 61 | fn do_something(parent: &Hierarchical

) { | ------ has type `&Hierarchical<'1, P>` 62 | let h: &dyn View = parent; | ^^^^^^ cast requires that `'1` must outlive `'static` = note: `dyn View` without an explicit lifetime implies 'static, not '_ ``` The idea is to have a note that tells you where `'static` came from in the error message, so that if a shorter lifetime is intended, the user is told where the problem comes from.
